CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 13, 1958, pg. 1 reads: "Republicans Urge Equal Rights for All Citizens in Campaign Platform for '58 - Two Stalwarts Were There - William P. Young, left, and Walter C. Rainey attended last Saturday's Republican State Committee meeting and listened intently to the platform pledges. Mr. Young was a councilmanic candidate in 1951,1953 and 1955.  Mr. Rainey is the party nominee for State Legislature in Fifth District." Portion of accompanying article reads: "The Republican State Committee met at Hotel Webster Hall last Saturday morning and adopted a campaign platform pledging equal rights for all Pennsylvania citizens in the fields of education, employment, organized labor and housing..."
TitMainTitle: Women, and men, including William P. Young wearing striped necktie, seated behind Walter C. Rainey holding hat with striped band, gathered in Webster Hotel for Republican State Committee meeting
